New Records: The Cavaliers tied a franchise record with 83 points in the first half
The Cavaliers set a team record with a 41-point halftime lead
The Cavaliers surpassed 130 points five times this season, matching the franchise record
Key Match Events: The Cavaliers scored 136 points on a night Donovan Mitchell, their best player, shot 4 of 13 and scored only 12 points
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Kerr sees shades of early Warriors in Kenny Atkinson’s Cavs
Kenny Atkinson has taken advantage of the situation in Cleveland, similar to how Steve Kerr did in 2014 with the Warriors
Atkinson has installed more motion on offense to create better looks
Post-Match Reflections: Green and Steph Curry still remain as the pillars of the Warriors, but the Cavs have been completely torn down and rebuilt since their last Finals appearance in 2018
The Cavaliers have already surpassed 130 points five times this season, it matches the franchise record
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers are the only team shooting better than 50 percent overall and lead the league in 3-point percentage

The Cavaliers are second in made 3s, have the second-best point differential and at 10-0 and remain the last unbeaten with the league’s best start to a season since these Warriors went 24-0 to begin 2015-16
Evan Mobley plays from the pocket now similar to how Draymond Green does with the Warriors
Others: The entire roster is back from last year, the only real change was to Atkinson and the coaching staff
Kenny Atkinson has a pre-existing relationship with guys like Jarrett Allen and Caris LeVert from their days together with the Nets
